title: How to Play the Game "Push the Button"

steps.headline: Take a piece of plain or lined paper, and on one side make a list of names.
steps.description: For example, people at your school. You need to separate these into two columns: boys and girls. Also, number the names, with an equal number of names. You can have however many people as you want for each gender.

steps.headline: Take the piece of paper and fold it in half 3 times hamburger style.
Choose one of the outside faces of the folded paper.
steps.description: This will be the "cover". Write the words "Push" on the outside and draw a button (or at least a circle.)

steps.headline: Unfold the paper again, so the paper is only folded in half.
steps.description: On this section write actions for the player to do to a mystery person, like "kiss", "hug", "high-five", "say 'I love You'", etc. There can be as many of these as you choose.

steps.headline: Find someone to play with you.
steps.description: Go up to the person, or your friend and ask them to "push the button". Let them press the button on your "push the button".

steps.headline: Unfold the paper and ask them to pick either "girl" or "boy".
steps.description: This will be the gender of the person they have to do the action to.

steps.headline: Once they do this, unfold the paper.
steps.description: Let the person pick an action to do to the mystery person.

steps.headline: Once they have picked, ask them a number between 1 and the number of students you have in each column.
The number the person chooses determines who they will "hug", "kiss", "ask out", or anything else.
steps.description: Make them do it. Soon, this game will catch on with your whole grade. Another way to make this game is to get a piece of paper and fold it into four sections. Draw a circle, and put push under it. Then put categories like Boy, Car, House, Money, etc. ad list several choices for each. Ask someone to push the button. Then open it and say "Boy. One to- however many you have." The crazier the ideas, the better! I have one 11 pages long, typed, with 158 jobs and 108 deaths!

text: Construction Take a piece of plain or lined paper, and on one side make a list of names. For example, people at your school. You need to separate these into two columns: boys and girls. Also, number the names, with an equal number of names. You can have however many people as you want for each gender. Take the piece of paper and fold it in half 3 times hamburger style.  Choose one of the outside faces of the folded paper. This will be the "cover". Write the words "Push" on the outside and draw a button (or at least a circle.) Unfold the paper once. On this part, write "Girl" or "Boy". Unfold the paper again, so the paper is only folded in half. On this section write actions for the player to do to a mystery person, like "kiss", "hug", "high-five", "say 'I love You'", etc. There can be as many of these as you choose. Gameplay Find someone to play with you. Go up to the person, or your friend and ask them to "push the button". Let them press the button on your "push the button". Unfold the paper and ask them to pick either "girl" or "boy". This will be the gender of the person they have to do the action to. Once they do this, unfold the paper. Let the person pick an action to do to the mystery person. Once they have picked, ask them a number between 1 and the number of students you have in each column.  The number the person chooses determines who they will "hug", "kiss", "ask out", or anything else. Make them do it. Soon, this game will catch on with your whole grade. Another way to make this game is to get a piece of paper and fold it into four sections. Draw a circle, and put push under it. Then put categories like Boy, Car, House, Money, etc. ad list several choices for each. Ask someone to push the button. Then open it and say "Boy. One to- however many you have." The crazier the ideas, the better! I have one 11 pages long, typed, with 158 jobs and 108 deaths!
